name: Table
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Spanner.

First, install @google-cloud/spanner with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/spanner

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/spannerâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var spanner = require('@google-cloud/spanner')();

Elsewhere

var spanner = require('@google-cloud/spanner')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/spanner are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Table
methods.description: Create a Table object to interact with a table in a Cloud Spanner database.

params.name: name
params.description: • Name of the table.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: schema
params.description: • See database#createTable.

methods.name: createReadStream
methods.description: Create a readable object stream to receive rows from the database using key lookups and scans.

examples.caption: Provide an array for query.keys to read with a composite key.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: table
params.description: • The table to read from.

params.name: query
params.description: • Configuration object. See ReadRequest.

params.name: query.columns
params.description: • The columns of the table to be returned for each row matching this query.

params.name: query.keys
params.description: • The primary keys of the rows in this table to be yielded. If using a composite key, provide an array within this array. See the example below.

params.name: query.index
params.description: • The name of an index on the table.

params.name: query.limit
params.description: • The number of rows to return.

params.name: options
params.description: • Transaction options.

params.name: options.exactStaleness
params.description: • Executes all reads at the timestamp that is exactStaleness old.

params.name: options.minReadTimestamp
params.description: • Executes all reads at a timestamp greater than or equal to this.

params.name: options.maxStaleness
params.description: • Read data at a timestamp that is greater than or equal to this.

params.name: options.readTimestamp
params.description: • Execute all reads at the given timestamp.

params.name: options.returnReadTimestamp
params.description: • If true, returns the read timestamp.

params.name: options.strong
params.description: • Read at the timestamp where all previously committed transactions are visible.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

examples.code:
var keys = ['Id1', 'Id2', 'Id3'];

table.deleteRows(keys, function(err, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: Provide an array for keys to delete rows with a composite key.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: keys
params.description: • The keys for the rows to delete. If using a composite key, provide an array within this array. See the example below.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

methods.name: insert
methods.description: Insert rows of data into this table.

examples.caption: Multiple rows can be inserted at once.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: keyVals
params.description: • A map of names to values of data to insert into this table.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

methods.name: read
methods.description:
Receive rows from the database using key lookups and scans.

Performance Considerations

This method wraps the streaming method, spanner/table#createReadStream for your convenience. All rows will be stored in memory before being released to your callback. If you intend on receiving a lot of results from your query, consider using the streaming method, so you can free each result from memory after consuming it.

examples.caption: Provide an array for query.keys to read with a composite key.
Rows are returned as an array of object arrays. Each object has a name and value property. To get a serialized object, call toJSON().
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: query
params.description: • Configuration object, describing what to read from the table.

params.name: query.columns
params.description: • The columns of the table to be returned for each row matching this query.

params.name: query.keys
params.description: • The primary keys of the rows in this table to be yielded. If using a composite key, provide an array within this array. See the example below.

params.name: query.index
params.description: • The name of an index on the table.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: query.limit
params.description: • The number of rows to return.

params.name: options
params.description: • Transaction options.

params.name: options.exactStaleness
params.description: • Executes all reads at the timestamp that is exactStaleness old.

params.name: options.minReadTimestamp
params.description: • Executes all reads at a timestamp greater than or equal to this.

params.name: options.maxStaleness
params.description: • Read data at a timestamp that is greater than or equal to this.

params.name: options.readTimestamp
params.description: • Execute all reads at the given timestamp.

params.name: options.returnReadTimestamp
params.description: • If true, returns the read timestamp.

params.name: options.strong
params.description: • Read at the timestamp where all previously committed transactions are visible.

params.name: callback.rows
params.description: • Rows are returned as an array of object arrays. Each object has a name and value property. To get a serialized object, call toJSON().

methods.name: replace
methods.description: Replace rows of data within this table.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: keyVals
params.description: • A map of names to values of data to insert into this table.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback

params.description: • The full API response.

methods.name: upsert
methods.description: Insert or update rows of data within this table.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: keyVals
params.description: • A map of names to values of data to insert into this table.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.
